name: CreatePersistedFolder
description:
Create a persisted folder in a Datadog environment.

Use this tool to create a persistent storage folder within a specified Datadog project environment.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: The ID of the Datadog project for accessing a specific environment. Obtain this by calling /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the persisted folder to be created in the environment.

parameters.name: folder_type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the folder to create. Acceptable values are 'home' for Home directory and 'pinned' for Pinned directory.

parameters.name: folder_creation_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp indicating when the folder was created. It should be in ISO 8601 format.

parameters.name: folder_updated_at
parameters.description: Timestamp indicating when the folder was last updated.

parameters.name: folder_protocol
parameters.description: Specify the protocol for the persisted folder, typically as a string indicator.

parameters.name: persisted_folder_path
parameters.description: Specify the path for the persisted folder in the Datadog environment. This should be a valid directory path within the project.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the PostHog API.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
